page.title: 16Crime in Swindon.
page.content: Swindon's crime-rate is on the national average and is concerned mostly with shop-lifting, vehicle thefts and burglary. Assault crimes are not common and soccer violence in Swindon is on a small scale. The 13-18 year olds make up the largest age group involved in crime and take up a great deal of police time in sorting out all types of minor crime. The worst crime committed in Swindon this year was the stabbing to death of a young man in a heated arguement outside a public house. The police are trying to improve their image with the public after violent confrontations with striking miners. A community policing scheme is aimed at building links with young people and develop a more caring attitude.
